intro: Corysanthera vestita, commonly known as the naked corysanthera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers are typically pale pink or white, with five petals and a prominent yellow center. Corysanthera vestita is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
